title: How to Make Potato and Channa Dal Curry

steps.headline: Boil the channa dal in 3 glasses[450 ml] water with a tsp of turmeric for 8 minutes in a pressure cooker.
Add ½ tsp of oil to the dal  to prevent the dal from bubbling over.
steps.description: The dal should be soft but not mashed. Retain the liquid.

steps.headline: Boil the potatoes, peel and quarter them.
In a heated heavy bottomed pan, add oil.
When the oil is hot, add the cinnamon and cloves.
steps.description: After about 30 seconds, add the ginger garlic paste.

steps.headline: Once the smell of raw ginger has disappeared (after about 3 mins), add the finely chopped onion.
steps.description: Stir occasionally. Let the onions become glassy.

steps.headline: Add the tomatoes, and sauté till the tomatoes become soft.
Stir in the cooked dal with the liquid, chilli powder, coriander powder, and salt.
steps.description: Stir in the cooked potatoes last. Let it simmer for 5-7 min on a low flame.

steps.headline: Add the coconut milk and cook for 4-5 min.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve your rich spicy gravy!

text: Boil the channa dal in 3 glasses[450 ml] water with a tsp of turmeric for 8 minutes in a pressure cooker.  Add ½ tsp of oil to the dal  to prevent the dal from bubbling over. The dal should be soft but not mashed. Retain the liquid. Boil the potatoes, peel and quarter them.  In a heated heavy bottomed pan, add oil.  When the oil is hot, add the cinnamon and cloves. After about 30 seconds, add the ginger garlic paste. Once the smell of raw ginger has disappeared (after about 3 mins), add the finely chopped onion. Stir occasionally. Let the onions become glassy. Add the tomatoes, and sauté till the tomatoes become soft.  Stir in the cooked dal with the liquid, chilli powder, coriander powder, and salt. Stir in the cooked potatoes last. Let it simmer for 5-7 min on a low flame. Add the coconut milk and cook for 4-5 min.  Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve your rich spicy gravy!
